title: Enhancing Machine Learning Practical Competencies: Reflective Practice-Based Instructional Design in Remote Education Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms and understanding of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Identify three or more learner interaction challenges in remote education environments and propose improvement strategies
Apply reflective practitioner research methodologies to analyze and refine personal instructional design processes at least twice

Learners can design three instructional strategies (e.g., gamification, real-time feedback system, collaborative learning tasks) to measure learner engagement on an online science lab platform (e.g., Labster) within four weeks, implement a prototype, and verify effectiveness through peer evaluation and experimental data (engagement improvement over 20%).

Learners can establish a three-stage action plan (problem diagnosis → solution design → evaluation) using AI-based scheduling tools (e.g., Google Calendar API, Notion templates) to address time management issues (e.g., delayed assignment submissions, reduced real-time class participation) in remote instruction and achieve over 80% satisfaction in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
